parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The installation of tires with inadequate load capacity can lead to tire failure, including tread separation and blowouts, which can cause accidents, damage to the vehicle or trailer, and potentially result in injuries or fatalities.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Premature Brake Shoe Wear and Brake Drum Damage
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Premature wear of brake shoes and damage to brake drums can lead to reduced braking performance, increased stopping distances, and potentially cause accidents.
symptoms: grinding or screeching noise when applying the brakes
brake drums need frequent turning or replacement.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Improper installation of trailer components, such as water tanks or tires, can lead to accidents, damage, or loss of control while towing, posing a risk to the driver and other road users.
symptoms: Water tank falls out while towing
trailer tires are not strong enough to support the rated axle weight load

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Using lightweight truck tires on a trailer instead of trailer-specific tires can lead to tire failure, loss of control, or accidents while towing, compromising the safety of the driver and other road users.
symptoms: Trailer tires are not strong enough to support the rated axle weight load
